meanings.definition: To haul or hoist with a tackle.
meanings.sent1: The sailors were tricing up the heavy cargo onto the ship.
meanings.sent2: He triced the bag of groceries onto his bike before riding home.
meanings.sent3: She triced the kite to the tree branch to keep it from flying away.
meanings.sent4: The crane triced the container effortlessly to the top of the building.
meanings.sent5: Tricing the flag up the pole, he felt a sense of accomplishment.

meanings.definition: To bind or secure with a rope or line.
meanings.sent1: The camper triced the food bag high in the tree to keep it safe from bears.
meanings.sent2: She triced her shoelaces tightly to prevent them from coming undone.
meanings.sent3: He triced the door shut with a rope, pretending it was a drawbridge.
meanings.sent4: The detective triced the crime scene with caution tape to preserve evidence.
meanings.sent5: Tricing the boat to the dock, he made sure it wouldn't drift away.

meanings.definition: A quick or sudden movement or action.
meanings.sent1: The cat made a tricing leap onto the table to catch the mouse.
meanings.sent2: His tricing reaction saved him from stepping on the slippery floor.
meanings.sent3: The tricing of the squirrel startled the birds nearby.
meanings.sent4: Her tricing decision to turn left instead of right led her to a hidden garden.
meanings.sent5: The tricing of the rabbit through the bushes was a blur of fur and speed.
